intro: Tryphostemma zanzibaricum, commonly known as the Zanzibar milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. Its showy, yellowish-orange flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils along the shores of Zanzibar and nearby islands.
